NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 2018 | 2017 | 2016 | 2015 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Provisional Data* as of April 4, 2018 NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Zika virus disease is a nationally notifiable condition. Cases are reported to CDC by state, territorial, and local health departments using standard case definitions. This webpage contains provisional data reported to ArboNET for 2017. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR US States NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 432 symptomatic Zika virus disease cases reported † 419 cases in travelers returning from affected areas 5 cases acquired through presumed local mosquito-borne transmission in Florida (N=2) and Texas (N=3) 8 cases acquired through other routes, including sexual transmission (N=7), and laboratory transmission (N=1) NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR US Territories NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR 653 Zika virus disease cases reported † 1 case in a traveler returning from an affected area 652 cases acquired through presumed local mosquito-borne transmission 0 cases acquired through other routes ‡ NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Footnotes NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR *Data are provisional and might not reflect the actual number of Zika virus disease cases due to delays in reporting. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR †Excludes congenital disease cases. Data reported to the US Zika Pregnancy Registry for outcomes of pregnancies with laboratory evidence of possible Zika virus infection in the United States is available at https://www.cdc.gov/zika/reporting/pregnancy-outcomes.html. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR ‡Sexually transmitted cases are not reported for US territories because with local transmission of Zika virus it is not possible to determine whether infection occurred due to mosquito-borne or sexual transmission.
